title: Ironbridge Gorge
description: The world's first iron bridge was built here in 1779, marking a significant milestone in the Industrial Revolution.
author: Abraham Darby III

title: Cromford Mill
description: The world's first water-powered cotton spinning mill, established by Richard Arkwright in 1771.
address: Mill Rd, Cromford, Matlock DE4 3RQ, United Kingdom
author: Richard Arkwright

title: Stephenson's Rocket
description: An early steam locomotive of 0-2-2 wheel arrangement, designed by Robert Stephenson in 1829.
address: Science Museum, Exhibition Rd, South Kensington, London SW7 2DD, United Kingdom
author: Robert Stephenson

title: Quarry Bank Mill
description: One of the best-preserved textile mills of the Industrial Revolution, founded in 1784.
author: Samuel Greg

title: Coalbrookdale Museum of Iron
description: Site of the first coke-fired blast furnace, marking the beginning of the Industrial Revolution.
address: Coach Rd, Coalbrookdale, Telford TF8 7DQ, United Kingdom
author: Abraham Darby I
